metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11043 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 7.1.x below 7.1.33, 7.2.x below 7.2.24 and 7.3.x below 7.3.11 in certain configurations of FPM setup it is possible to cause FPM module to write past allocated buffers into the space reserved for FCGI protocol data, thus opening the possibility of remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm6').
